#Text=Budapest/Várkerület
#Text=Várkerület ( Castle District ) is a district in Budapest .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Bel-Buda is officially known as ' Várkerület ' ( lit .
#Text=Castle district ) .
#Text=It includes Watertown ( Vízíváros , Fő utca ) , Castle Hill ( Budai Várnegyed ) , Taban ( Tabán ) and Kristinatown ( Krisztinaváros ) .
#Text=The borders of the district are Gellért Hill , South ( Déli ) Railway Station and , at its northernmost point , the Margaret Bridge 's bridgehead on its Buda side .
#Text=Administratively this is First district ( abbrev . I. ) which is bounded in the northwest II .
#Text=and XII . district , the Mount area ( Hegyvidék ) , in south the XI . district ( Újbuda ) while in the east the Danube , by the V. district the Downtown
#Text=( Belváros ) .
#Text=Castle Hill , known as Várhegy in Hungarian , was first settled in the thirteenth century , after a Mongol attack led Buda 's citizens to seek a more easily defended area .
#Text=The royal Hungarian court also decided to move , to the southern end of the hill .
#Text=By the fourteenth century , there were an estimated 8,000 residents in Buda .
#Text=After a long ( 1541 – 1686 ) period of Turkish rule , a 75-day siege left Buda in ruins , and Austrian authorities counted a mere 300 people left .
#Text=This would not be the last heavy attack on Castle Hill .
#Text=In 1849 and 1945 the Baroquified area once more came under attack .
#Text=A completely surrounded German force held out for almost a month in January 1945 , in the thirty-first siege of the city .
#Text=Since 1987 part of the UNESCO World Heritage List .
#Text=The three main part of the Castle district ( Várnegyed ) are : the Buda Castle Palace , the area of St George 's Square ( Szent György tér ) and the historical residential area .
#Text=Tourist information point
#Text=Tourinform - Buda Castle , I. Tárnok u. 15 ( From : ' Deák Ferenc tér ' take bus 16 to Szentháromság tér
#Text=) .

#Text=Daily 09:00 – 18:00 . stocks a comprehensive range of free leaflets , maps and listings magazines and free guidebooks which offer lots of ideas about sights and sounds , gastronomy , shopping , by night and lifestyle .
#Text=You can also book shows , concerts and sightseeing tickets .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Metro lines M2 ( red ) and M4 ( green ) cross the Danube from Pest to the Buda side .

#Text=M2 stops at three major transport hubs : Batthyány Square ( gaze at the view to the Parliament before changing to the HÉV suburban train for Szentendre ) , Széll Kálmán Square ( former Moszkva Square , gateway to the Castle Hill in fact this is on the I. and II . districts perimeter ) and Southern Railway Station ( Déli pályaudvar ) ( southern railway station ) .
#Text=You can take trams tram : no . 19 , 41 , 56 , 56A . at west limits of the district useful the tram : 59 , 59A , 59B . tram : 4 & 6 also serve district needs .
#Text=The zero statue on the Clark Ádám Square ( „ 0 ” kilométerkő ) , Clark Ádám Square ( Bus 16 , 105 , tram : 19 , 41 ) .
#Text=This is at the western end of the Сhain Bridge ( Széchenyi Lánchíd ) , which is considered to be the most beautiful of the bridges over the Danube .
#Text=The square is also home to the zero statue that signifies the start ( or end ) point of journeys from the capital as shown on the roadsigns on major roads .
#Text=South Railwaystation ( Déli pályaudvar ) ( : ' Déli pályaudvar ' , tram : 17 , 56 , 56A , 59 , 59A , 59B , 61 .
#Text=Bel-Buda railway station is the terminus of metro line M2 ( red ) .
#Text=Batthyany Square transport hub ( Batthyány tér ) , Batthyany square .

#Text=This is a combined transport hub there is station , the end terminal - only this HÉV-station is underground , in all Budapest , - for north direction to Óbuda , to suburbs , to Szentendre where is the southern end of the very nice Danube Bend .
#Text=A couple of citybus and two tram lines stop also here .
#Text=This port will affect the following boat services D11 and D12 .
#Text=Nightbus 956 , 960
#Text=) .
#Text=One of the main transport hub of Buda , makes the most convenient entry point to the Castle District .
#Text=You can walk upon the hill ( it takes about 20 minutes ) or take the bus 16 or 16A .
#Text=When you come up from the subway station look for the outdoor stairway leading to a pedestrian bridge over the trolley tracks .
#Text=Up the steps , over the tracks , cross the street to the mid-block bus stop .
#Text=Széna tér bus station ( Széna tér buszpályaudvar ) , II .
#Text=Széna tér ( : ' Széll Kálmán tér '
#Text=Cash desk M - F 06:00 - 18:00 ; Sa - Su 06:00 - 16:00 - public toilets M - F 08:00 - 18:00 , Sa , Su 08:00 - 14:00 , Buffet daily 06:00 - 18:00 , Newspaper sales 06:00 - 18:00 .
#Text=Buses depart from here to the northwestern suburb , Zsámbék village and neighbouring areas .
#Text=There is a ticket vending machine .
#Text=Timetable and list of destinations : here
#Text=It 's also pleasant to walk by Chain Bridge ( Széchenyi lánchíd ) from Pest and walk up by the narrow streets or paths ( as Király lépcső or Kemál Atatürk sétány ) .
#Text=Walking from Pest is likely to be faster than public transport or taxi on peak hours .
#Text=Get around
#Text=This district is small enough to discover it on foot .
#Text=However , if you get tired , you can jump on bus 5 or 11 86 which has several stops inside the Bel-Buda District , or two convenient trams : 19 and 41 go along the Buda bank of the river .
#Text=There is also a bicycle route in parallel to it .
#Text=Tram 56 and 56A could be useful to explore Taban ( Tabán ) and Kristinatown ( Krisztinaváros ) on Krisztina boulevard .
#Text=In Buda Castle area you can use bus 16 ( formerly known as Várbusz ) which has several stops inside the Castle District .
#Text=Pricey horse carriages are also waiting for taking you on a tour .
#Text=As private cars are not allowed to enter the Castle Hill zone , your only options remain public transport , walking or taxi .
#Text=Other transport modes
#Text=Cable car , Lower station ( Budavári Sikló , alsó állomás ) , Clark Adam Square ( From Deák square take bus 105 , from Batthyány square take tram 19 , 41 ) .
#Text=The spectacular but very touristy and pricey cable car ( funicular ) called Budavári Sikló climbs up Castle Hill from Chain Bridge 's Buda side to Fisherman 's Bastion ( Halászbástya ) .
#Text=As the cable car is rising up the hill you get a beautiful view of Pest across the river .
#Text=Alternatively you can check the view from one of the two small pedestrian bridges over the cable car way - for free .
#Text=Ft 1000/1400 one way/return , children Ft 400/750 .
